meanings.definition: A hormone that inhibits the production of follicle-stimulating hormone.
meanings.sent1: The inhibins regulate the amount of follicle-stimulating hormone in the body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study inhibins to understand how they affect hormone levels.
meanings.sent3: The inhibins decided to take a break from inhibiting and went on vacation.
meanings.sent4: Her influence on the team was like that of inhibins, quietly controlling the outcome.
meanings.sent5: Inhibins act like traffic lights, stopping the production of certain hormones.

meanings.definition: Any of a group of glycoproteins that inhibit the secretion of follicle-stimulating hormone.
meanings.sent1: Researchers are investigating the role of inhibins in hormone regulation.
meanings.sent2: The body produces inhibins to help maintain hormonal balance.
meanings.sent3: The inhibins at the party were the life of the celebration, keeping things in check.
meanings.sent4: His words were like inhibins, halting the flow of information.
meanings.sent5: Inhibins are like gatekeepers, controlling the release of specific hormones.
